<item>
 <title>'Azhar' Review: Whether you’re a cricket fan or not, Emraan Hashmi's performance keeps you glued</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/review-azhar-review-whether-you-re-a-cricket-fan-or-not-emraan-hashmi-s-performance-keeps-you-glued-2211980</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><strong>Movie:</strong> <em>Azhar</em>&nbsp;<br />
	<strong>Starring:</strong> Emraan Hashmi, Prachi Desai, Nargis Fakhri, Lara Dutta, Kunal Roy Kapoor, Kulbhushan Kharbanda and Shernaz Patel<br />
	<strong>Directed by:</strong> Tony D&#39;Souza</p>
<h3>What It&#39;s about:</h3>
<p>Everyone loves a sporting hero &ndash; the guy who comes from nowhere and wins hearts of the nation. It doesn&#39;t happen too often. What happens even lesser is when the very fans who put him on the pedestal, pull him down because they find him unworthy of the love and adulation. <em>Azhar</em> is the story of a fallen hero&rsquo;s fight for his lost dignity. From a lower middle-class background in Hyderabad, Mohammed Azharuddin (Emraan) rises to become one of India&rsquo;s most successful captains in the world of cricket. But the journey is speckled with controversies and scandals galore. On the personal front, he makes headlines when he romances a film heroine Sangeeta (Nargis) who he eventually marries after leaving his first wife Naureen (Prachi). On the career front, he is banned from playing cricket after being accused of match fixing. The film tracks Azhar&rsquo;s journey as he combats his inner battles with a clear mission &ndash; to have his name cleared.</p>
<p><iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="360" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/YGf8j9Fxn4w" width="640"></iframe></p>
<h3>What&#39;s good:</h3>
<p>There are two ways to make a biopic &ndash; you either position it like a docu-drama or take the populist route. Director Tony D&rsquo;Souza opts for the latter, which is a clever move because Mohammed Azharuddin was always a people&rsquo;s hero. For the most part of the film, the reconstruction of Azhar&#39;s life from real to reel is authentic. Tony begins his lead character&rsquo;s story on the right note &ndash; his entry on the cricket field on the day of his grandfather&rsquo;s death to Ravi Shastri&#39;s role in his selection. The film sails along seamlessly in the first half with the endearing portions between Azhar and Naureen being the highlights. The real Azharuddin has endorsed the film and it&rsquo;s commendable that he gave his nod to the portrayal of all the grey areas in his life &ndash; his infidelity, insensitivity, betrayal, insult, and humiliation is there for public consumption. The most important part is the admission of accepting money from a bookie &ndash; even if for a larger reason. Tony has added some delicious moments in the film &ndash; look out for the fight with Manoj (Prabhakar) in the locker room; Ravi&rsquo;s (Shastri) wife barging into the spa looking for her philandering husband; Navjyot (Sidhu) refusing to support Azhar and even Kapil (Dev) looking the other way. Azharuddin, as we know him, was always a shy, awkward guy who didn&#39;t speak eloquently or display emotions openly. Emraan Hashmi gets the character perfect to the core &ndash; from the body language to the attitude. It&#39;s a&nbsp;credit to Emraan that you feel the pain of Azhar going from the most loved man to the most hated man in the country. There is a scene where Azhar is called for a ribbon cutting &ndash; Emraan&rsquo;s act in that will make you cringe. The conflict that Azhar feels before dating Sangeeta, whether real or aimed at whitewashing, is interesting and effective. As is Azhar&#39;s insistence of keeping his wives, parents and kids out of the court, despite being abandoned by his friends and colleagues. There is something uniquely real about Naureen&#39;s character from her appearance to her dialogues. Prachi brings to life the dignity and charm of Azhar&#39;s former wife with her performance. The non-linear format of the film accentuates the impact. Rajat Arora&rsquo;s dialogues add the necessary chutzpah to Azhar&rsquo;s character.</p>
<h3>What&#39;s not:</h3>
<p>A major part of the film is in the confines of a courtroom. Sadly, that&rsquo;s the portion that seems dreary. Both the lawyers (Lara Dutta and Kunal Roy Kapoor) in the film are like caricatures. You also wish the film had dug deeper into the story. It feels incomplete; questions still remain unanswered. Nargis Fakhri looks glamorous despite her distracting duck pout but she should strictly avoid roles where she has to emote even remotely.</p>
<h3>What to do:</h3>
<p>Whether you&rsquo;re a cricket fan or not, <em>Azhar</em> will keep you glued to the seat. Go for it.&nbsp;</p>
<h3>Rating:&nbsp;***1/2</h3>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/review">Review</a><a href="/entertainment">Entertainment</a><a href="/authors/sarita-a-tanwar">Sarita A Tanwar</a><a href="/agencies/dna">dna</a><a href="/cities/mumbai-16">Mumbai</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/azhar">Azhar</a></li><li><a href="/topic/emraan-hashmi">Emraan Hashmi</a></li><li><a href="/topic/prachi-desai">Prachi Desai</a></li><li><a href="/topic/mohammad-azaharuddin">Mohammad Azaharuddin</a></li><li><a href="/topic/nargis-fakhri">Nargis Fakhri</a></li><li><a href="/topic/ravi-shastri">Ravi Shastri</a></li><li><a href="/topic/tony-d-souza">Tony D&#039;Souza</a></li><li><a href="/topic/lara-dutta">Lara Dutta</a></li><li><a href="/topic/sangeeta-bijlani">Sangeeta Bijlani</a></li><li><a href="/topic/film-reviews">Film Reviews</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-01:02pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 1:02pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">

<item>
 <title>Restaurants, logistics companies can fit delivery boxes on two-wheelers from Oct 1</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/money/report-restaurants-logistics-companies-can-fit-delivery-boxes-on-two-wheelers-from-oct-1-2211978</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Restaurants, e-commerce companies and logistics companies have been facing trouble for a long time to make quick and efficient deliveries possible. This is because, so far, the Central Motor Vehicles Rules, 1989, did not allow two-wheelers to be fitted with delivery boxes.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Even though the fitment of delivery boxes on two-wheelers was not allowed so far, many restaurants and e-commerce logistics companies have already been following the practice, leading to the delivery boys often being pulled up by the traffic police for violating the law.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Now, a notification dated May 2, 2016, from the Road Transport and Highways has said that companies and restaurants will be allowed to fit a small delivery box on the two-wheeler from October 1, 2016, onwards.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&quot;In the Central Motor Vehicles Rules,1989 (hereafter referred as the said rules), in rule 123, after the first proviso, the following proviso shall be inserted, namely:- &#39;Provided that on and after 1st October, 2016, a light weight container may be fitted on a motorcycle provided it meets the requirements.&quot; &nbsp;</p>
<p>This is, however, subject to certain conditions like dimensions, according to the notification from the Ministry.</p>
<p>i) the dimensions of the container shall not exceed 550 mm in length, 510 mm in width and 500 mm in height;</p>
<p>(ii) weight of the container including its mounting and the load carried in the container shall not exceed 30 kgs;</p>
<p>(iii) if such container is fitted on the pillion rider space, then no pillion rider shall be allowed:&nbsp;Provided that the weight of container including its mounting and the load carried in the container, shall be within the permissible Gross Vehicle Weight in kg, specified by the vehicle manufacturer and also approved by the test agency referred to in rule 126;</p>
<p>(iv) if such container is fitted behind the pillion rider space then no pillion rider should be allowed to be seated: Provided that the weight of the pillion rider, and weight of the container including its mounting and the load carried in the container, shall be within permissible Gross Vehicle Weight in kg, specified by the vehicle manufacturer and also approved by the test agency referred to in rule 126.&rdquo;</p>
<p>The National Restaurant Association of India said that it has been engaging with the Ministry for this matter since 2012. Commenting on the devleopment, NRAI said, &quot;NRAI&rsquo;s consistent efforts have been successful, and&nbsp;the Ministry has agreed to the&nbsp;suggestion of&nbsp;including boxes fitted on two wheelers in the relevant rules.&quot;</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/money">Money</a><a href="/authors/dna-web-team">dna Web Team</a><a href="/agencies/dna-webdesk">dna webdesk</a><a href="/cities/mumbai-16">Mumbai</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/e-commerce">e-commerce</a></li><li><a href="/topic/restaurants">restaurants</a></li><li><a href="/topic/logistics-companies">logistics companies</a></li><li><a href="/topic/national-restaurants-association-of-india">National Restaurants Association of India</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-12:50pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 12:50pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">

<item>
 <title>Google now largest company after Apple sinks to 2-year low</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/scitech/report-google-now-largest-company-after-apple-sinks-to-2-year-low-2211975</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Shares of Apple sank below $90 for the first time in nearly two years during trade Thursday, ceding the title of the world&#39;s largest company by market valuation to Google.</p>
<p>With investors souring on the outlook for sales of its iPhones and iPads, and no new blockbuster consumer electronics product in its offerings, Apple shares fell sharply to $89.47 in early trade before coming back to end the day off 2.4 percent at $90.34.</p>
<p>That was enough to lose the title of the world&#39;s largest company to Google parent Alphabet, whose shares lost just 0.3 percent at $713.31.</p>
<p>Apple ended the day valued at $494.8 billion by market capitalization, while its Silicon Valley rival Google was just a bit shy of $500 billion.</p>
<p>Apple shares have lost about 14 percent since the beginning of 2016 and are down one-third from the peak of $132.54 one year ago.</p>
<p>Apple stock has slid sharply since mid-April, hit in part by the company&#39;s disappointing fiscal second-quarter earnings, which showed a decline in revenues and the first quarterly drop in iPhone unit sales since launching the smartphone in 2007.</p>
<p>Worries were mounting over the pace of iPhone sales, the company&#39;s top earner, amid reports that consumers worldwide are generally replacing their phones less often than before.</p>
<p>Key Asian producers of components for Apple were also seeing their shares pummelled on the forecast for slower iPhone sales.</p>
<p>And analysts at UBS cut their outlook for Apple&#39;s share price on Wednesday to $115 from $120 on lower sales forecasts.</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/scitech">Sci/Tech</a><a href="/agencies/afp-relax-news-0">AFP Relax News</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/apple">Apple</a></li><li><a href="/topic/google">Google</a></li><li><a href="/topic/ubs">UBS</a></li><li><a href="/topic/iphones-and-ipads-sales">iPhones and iPads sales</a></li><li><a href="/topic/consumer-electronics">Consumer Electronics</a></li><li><a href="/topic/alphabet">Alphabet</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-12:50pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 12:50pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">

<item>
 <title>Sleepless nights for Priyanka Chopra during 'Baywatch' shoot</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-sleepless-nights-for-priyanka-chopra-during-baywatch-shoot-2211972</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Bollywood actress Priyanka Chopra is busy filming <em>Baywatch</em>&nbsp;and she says night shoots have made her &quot;oblivion of sleep&quot;.</p>
<p>&quot;Oblivion... Such an interesting word.. Oblivion of sleep.. N so much more Tonight.. #Nightshoots #Baywatch,&quot; Priyanka posted on Twitter.</p>
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en"><p dir="ltr" lang="en">Oblivion... Such an interesting word.. Oblivion of sleep.. N so much more Tonight.. <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/Nightshoots?src=hash" rel="nofollow">#Nightshoots</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/Baywatch?src=hash" rel="nofollow">#Baywatch</a></p>
<p>	&mdash; PRIYANKA (@priyankachopra) <a href="https://twitter.com/priyankachopra/status/730696853822570496" rel="nofollow">May 12, 2016</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p>The 33-year-old <em>Quantico</em> actress is playing the villain Victoria Leeds in <em>Baywatch</em>&nbsp;movie which also stars Dwayne Johnson, Zac Efron, Alexandra Daddario and Kelly Rohrbac.</p>
<p>Original <em>Baywatch</em>&nbsp;TV series star David Hasselhoff and Pamela Anderson will make an appearance in the film.</p>
<p>It is slated to release on May 19, 2017.</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/entertainment">Entertainment</a><a href="/agencies/pti">PTI</a><a href="/cities/miami">Miami</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/priyanka-chopra">Priyanka Chopra</a></li><li><a href="/topic/baywatch">Baywatch</a></li><li><a href="/topic/quantico">Quantico</a></li><li><a href="/topic/alexandra-daddario">Alexandra Daddario</a></li><li><a href="/topic/dwayne-the-rock-johnson-0">Dwayne &#039;The Rock&#039; Johnson</a></li><li><a href="/topic/david-hasselhoff">David Hasselhoff</a></li><li><a href="/topic/pamela-anderson">Pamela Anderson</a></li><li><a href="/topic/zac-efron">Zac Efron</a></li><li><a href="/topic/hollywood">Hollywood</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-12:44pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 12:44pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">
  <div class="content">

<item>
 <title>No Indian city in list of world's best destinations for luxury retailers</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/money/report-no-indian-city-in-list-of-world-s-best-destinations-for-luxury-retailers-2211970</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>While Asia Pacific has emerged as the the favourite region for luxury retailers, no Indian city has found a place for itself on the list.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Seven out of ten cities on the top ten world&#39;s favourite destinations for luxury retailers list, put together by&nbsp;&nbsp;Jones Lang LaSalle&nbsp;(JLL) in its Destination Retail 2016 report, belong to the Asia Pacific region, however, there are no Indian cities on it.&nbsp;</p>
<p>This is the first such list by the real estate consultant, which has ranked cities according to their appeal to global luxury retailers.&nbsp;</p>
<p>London came in at the top spot and the list named three Chinese cities -- Hong Kong, Shanghai, Beijing and Taipei among the top ten.</p>
<p>Here&#39;s the top ten list</p>
<p>1. London</p>
<p>2. Hong Kong</p>
<p>3. Paris</p>
<p>4. Tokyo</p>
<p>5. New York</p>
<p>6. Shanghai</p>
<p>7. Singapore</p>
<p>8. Dubai</p>
<p>9. Beijing</p>
<p>10. Osaka</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/money">Money</a><a href="/authors/dna-web-team">dna Web Team</a><a href="/agencies/dna-webdesk">dna webdesk</a><a href="/cities/mumbai-16">Mumbai</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/jones-lang-lasalle-jll">Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL)</a></li><li><a href="/topic/real-estate">Real Estate</a></li><li><a href="/topic/luxury-retail">luxury retail</a></li><li><a href="/topic/london">London</a></li><li><a href="/topic/shanghai">Shanghai</a></li><li><a href="/topic/singapore">Singapore</a></li><li><a href="/topic/beijing">Beijing</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-12:05pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 12:05pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">

<item>
 <title>Jat riots: Parkash Singh Committee report points at 'negligence' by officials</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-jat-riots-parkash-singh-committee-report-points-at-negligence-by-officials-2211969</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>The Parkash Singh Committee, probing the role of police and civil administration officials during the Jat reservation stir, on Friday submitted its report to Haryana government, pointing towards &quot;negligence&quot; on the&nbsp;part of certain officials in controlling the situation.</p>
<p>The committee submitted its report to the Manohar Lal Khattar government, official sources said, adding, it pointed to &quot;negligence&quot; on part of certain officials and &quot;concerted efforts&quot; to control the situation by others in the report.</p>
<p>The Jat stir held in February this year resulted in blockades of roads, including national highways, violence and extensive damage to public and private properties in many districts, including Sonipat, Rohtak and Jhajjar.</p>
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-conversation="none" data-lang="en"><p dir="ltr" lang="en">We met victims at 8 places for probe (Rohtak,Jhajjar,Jind, Hisar, Kaithal,Bhiwani, Sonipat &amp; Panipat) &amp; recorded their stmnts: Prakash Singh</p>
<p>	&mdash; ANI (@ANI_news) <a href="https://twitter.com/ANI_news/status/731004509992816640" rel="nofollow">May 13, 2016</a></p></blockquote>
<p>Former police official Prakash Singh is understood to have done a thorough study of existing structures, procedures and systems for maintenance of law and order in the state and suggested such improvements in these, as he deems necessary, to prevent recurrence of such incidents in future.</p>
<p>Singh, now retired, was Member, National Security Advisory Board during 2013-14 and is one of the foremost experts of the country on Internal Security.</p>
<p>At present, he is Associate Fellow of the Joint Special Operations University (US) and President, Indian Police Foundation and Member, Advisory Board of Vivekananda International Foundation.</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/india">India</a><a href="/agencies/pti">PTI</a><a href="/cities/chandigarh-1">Chandigarh</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/jat-quota-agitation">Jat quota agitation</a></li><li><a href="/topic/haryana">Haryana</a></li><li><a href="/topic/manohar-lal-khattar">Manohar Lal Khattar</a></li><li><a href="/topic/rohtak">Rohtak</a></li><li><a href="/topic/parkash-singh-committee">Parkash Singh Committee</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-12:10pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 12:10pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">

<item>
 <title>Eicher Motors shares slip nearly 4% after promoters sell stake </title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/money/report-eicher-motors-shares-slip-after-promoters-sell-42-stake-at-rs-2100-crore-2211967</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Eicher&nbsp;Motors Ltd (EML) on Friday said two of its promoters and&nbsp;Eicher&nbsp;Goodearth&nbsp;Trust have sold 4.2% stake in the company for&nbsp;Rs&nbsp;2,100 crore.&nbsp;Post the development, shares of&nbsp;Eicher&nbsp;Motors were trading at&nbsp;Rs 19,025.00, down Rs 724.55 or 3.67% at 1213 hours on the BSE.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&quot;Anita&nbsp;Lal,&nbsp;Rukmani&nbsp;Joshi&nbsp;and The&nbsp;Eicher&nbsp;Goodearth&nbsp;Trust, part of the promoter group... have sold 11.40&nbsp;lakh&nbsp;equity shares in&nbsp;EML, representing 4.2% of&nbsp;EML&#39;s&nbsp;equity shares, for an aggregate realisation of&nbsp;Rs&nbsp;2,100 crore,&quot;&nbsp;Eicher&nbsp;Motors said in a regulatory filing.</p>
<p>With the stake sale, the commercial vehicle manufacturer, which also owns niche bike maker Royal&nbsp;Enfield, said promoter group&nbsp;shareholding&nbsp;now stands at 50.67%.</p>
<p>It further said: &quot;This sale has been done to provide liquidity to the promoters, and the proceeds will be utilised for personal uses, such as portfolio and other investments, and charitable purposes.&quot;</p>
<p>The company said the promoters intend to maintain a majority share in&nbsp;EML&nbsp;and &quot;do not plan to sell any further shares in the foreseeable future.&rdquo;</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/money">Money</a><a href="/agencies/pti">PTI</a><a href="/cities/new-delhi-29">New Delhi</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/eicher-motors">Eicher Motors</a></li><li><a href="/topic/royal-enfield">Royal Enfield</a></li><li><a href="/topic/eicher-goodearth-trust">Eicher Goodearth Trust</a></li><li><a href="/topic/bse">BSE</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-12:30pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 12:30pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">

<item>
 <title>Supreme Court upholds constitutional validity of penal laws on criminal defamation</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-supreme-court-upholds-constitutional-validity-of-penal-laws-on-criminal-defamation-2211963</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>In a landmark judgement with widespread ramifications, the Supreme Court on Friday upheld the constitutional validity of penal laws of defamation.</p>
<p>So in essence a person can still be jailed&nbsp;if it is proved that his/her words or actions were defamatory. &nbsp;It has dismissed a batch of petitions challenging the constitutional validity of sections 499 and 500 of the IPC providing for criminal defamation</p>
<p>SC in its verdict said, &quot;Mutual respect to each other is required to maintain the constitutional value that ensure the dignity of any individual&quot;. Even though the apex court upheld the provisions it said that magistrate has to be extremely careful while issuing summons under law.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Among the petitioners were eminent politicians like Congress vice president&nbsp;Rahul&nbsp;Gandhi, Delhi Chief Minister&nbsp;Arvind&nbsp;Kejriwal&nbsp;and&nbsp;Bharatiya&nbsp;Janata&nbsp;Party (BJP) leader&nbsp;Subramanian&nbsp;Swamy.</p>
<p>Deciding pleas of Rahul Gandhi, Arvind Kejriwal,Subramanian Swamy and others, SC says it will be open to them to move HC against summons issued in defamation cases. SC also said, &quot;&nbsp;Till they move HC within 8 weeks, interim protection to&nbsp;continue and criminal proceedings to remain stayed before trial court&quot;.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The petitioners earlier had argued that the criminal defamation under these sections of the&nbsp;IPC&nbsp;travelled beyond constitution&#39;s article 19(2) that imposes reasonable restriction on the freedom of speech and expression.&nbsp;The verdict was reserved on August 13 last year after bench of Justice&nbsp;Dipak&nbsp;Misra&nbsp;and Justice&nbsp;Prafulla&nbsp;C. Pant heard the matter spread over a month.</p>
<p>Swamy&nbsp;and Gandhi have been charged with criminal defamation under Sections 499 and 500 of the&nbsp;IPC&nbsp;for their political speeches made in Tamil&nbsp;Nadu&nbsp;and&nbsp;Maharashtra&nbsp;respectively, while&nbsp;Kejriwal&nbsp;is facing cases under the same provisions lodged by&nbsp;BJP&#39;s&nbsp;Nitin&nbsp;Gadkari&nbsp;and others.&nbsp;</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/india">India</a><a href="/agencies/agencies">Agencies</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/supreme-court">Supreme Court</a></li><li><a href="/topic/rahul-gandhi">Rahul Gandhi</a></li><li><a href="/topic/arvind-kejriwal">Arvind Kejriwal</a></li><li><a href="/topic/subramanian-swamy">Subramanian Swamy</a></li><li><a href="/topic/nitin-gadkari">Nitin Gadkari</a></li><li><a href="/topic/dipak-mishra">Dipak Mishra</a></li><li><a href="/topic/indian-penal-code-ipc">Indian Penal Code (IPC)</a></li><li><a href="/topic/criminal-defamation">criminal defamation</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-11:55am</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 11:55am</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-article-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="img-responsive" src="http://static.dnaindia.com/sites/default/files/styles/half/public/2016/05/13/459897-428941-supreme-court.jpg" width="640" height="360" alt="Supreme Court" title="Supreme Court" /></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-short-url field-type-text field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Short URL:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">dnai.in/2</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-embargo field-type-list-boolean field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Embargo:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-syndicate field-type-list-boolean field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Syndicate:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-hide-lead-image field-type-list-boolean field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Hide lead image:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-page-views field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Page views:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">439</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-print-edition field-type-list-boolean field-label-above"><div class="field-label">From Print Edition:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div></description>

<item>
 <title>Solar Impulse 2 continues its record-breaking flight</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/scitech/report-solar-impulse-2-continues-its-record-breaking-flight-2211962</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>The Solar Impulse 2 plane took off from Phoenix, Arizona en route to Oklahoma on Thursday, resuming its record-breaking quest to circle the globe without consuming a drop of fuel.</p>
<p>The experimental solar-powered aircraft, piloted by Swiss adventurer Bertrand Piccard, took off at 3:00 am (1000 GMT), live footage showed, for the latest stage of its around-the-world flight aimed at drawing attention to clean energy technologies.</p>
<p>&quot;Goodbye Phoenix, thank you for your warm and friendly welcome,&quot; Piccard tweeted from the cockpit.</p>
<p>The flight to the city of Tulsa is expected to take 17 and a half hours.</p>
<p>The plane is set to make one or two more stops in the United States before finally landing in New York City, in the latest leg of a journey that kicked off in Abu Dhabi on March 9, 2015.</p>
<p>&quot;The objective is to reach New York as soon as possible!&quot; the Solar Impulse 2 team said in a statement Wednesday, although it is not clear when the plane might reach there.</p>
<p>The aircraft was grounded in July last year when its batteries suffered problems halfway through its 21,700-mile (35,000-kilometer) circumnavigation.</p>
<p>The crew took several months to repair the damage from high tropical temperatures during the flight&#39;s final Pacific stage, a 4,000-mile (6,437-kilometer) flight between Nagoya, Japan and Hawaii.</p>
<p>The plane was flown on that stage by Piccard&#39;s teammate Andre Borschberg, whose 118-hour journey smashed the previous record of 76 hours and 45 minutes set by US adventurer Steve Fossett in 2006.</p>
<p>The Solar Impulse 2&#39;s wings, wider than those of a Boeing 747, contain 17,000 solar cells that power the aircraft&#39;s propellers and charge batteries.</p>
<p>At night, the plane runs on stored energy.</p>
<p>The typical flight speed is around 30 miles (45 kilometers) an hour, which can increase to double that when exposed to full sunlight.</p>
<p>After crossing the United States, the pilots are set to make a trans-Atlantic flight to Europe, from where they plan to make their way back to their point of departure in Abu Dhabi.</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/scitech">Sci/Tech</a><a href="/agencies/afp-relax-news-0">AFP Relax News</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/solar-impulse-2">Solar Impulse 2</a></li><li><a href="/topic/arizona">Arizona</a></li><li><a href="/topic/phoenix">Phoenix</a></li><li><a href="/topic/oklahoma">Oklahoma</a></li><li><a href="/topic/record-breaking-flight">record-breaking flight</a></li><li><a href="/topic/bertrand-piccard">Bertrand Piccard</a></li><li><a href="/topic/solar-powered-planes">Solar powered planes</a></li><li><a href="/topic/technology">Technology</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-11:54am</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 11:54am</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">

<item>
 <title>Atleast 12 killed in firing at Iraqi city of Balad</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/world/report-atleast-12-killed-in-firing-at-iraqi-city-of-balad-2211960</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Three gunmen opened fire on a popular cafe in the northern Iraqi town of Balad overnight, killing at least 12 people and wounding 25, police and hospital sources said on Friday.</p>
<p>The attack on the mainly Shi&#39;ite town 80 km (50 miles) north of Baghdad lasted for around 10 minutes during the start of the weekend in Iraq.&nbsp;The area is heavily secured, requiring the attackers to pass three police checkpoints before reaching their target, said police sources who declined to be identified as they were not authorised to speak to the media.</p>
<p>The shooting follows the <a href="http://www.dnaindia.com/world/report-at-least-13-killed-in-suicide-bomb-attack-near-baghdad-iraq-officials-2211064" target="_blank">bloodiest attacks</a> in the capital on Wednesday, when bombings claimed by Islamic State killed at least 80 people.</p>
<p>	&nbsp;</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/world">World</a><a href="/agencies/reuters">Reuters</a><a href="/cities/baghdad">Baghdad</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/iraq">Iraq</a></li><li><a href="/topic/shooting">shooting</a></li><li><a href="/topic/islamic-state">Islamic State</a></li><li><a href="/topic/baghdad">Baghdad</a></li><li><a href="/topic/attack">attack</a></li><li><a href="/topic/firing">firing</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-12:06pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 12:06pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">

<item>
 <title>Tamil Nadu Elections 2016: Jayalalithaa promises to enact law against NEET if voted to power</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-tamil-nadu-elections-2016-jayalalithaa-to-enact-law-against-neet-if-voted-into-power-2211959</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>On Thursday, Chief Minister and AIADMK general secretary J Jayalalithaa stated that if she gets voted back into power she will enact a strong law against NEET. The NEET exam has been made compulsory for those who want to pursue medicine. Her opinion is that NEET does not benefit the poor or those who come from rural backgrounds.&nbsp;</p>
<p>According to a <em>Deccan Chronicle</em> report, she stated that the&nbsp;AIADMK was against any entrance exam for medical and dental courses and had issued a government order in the past. In February&nbsp;2006, a legislation was brought in and the entrance exam was cancelled in 2007. Admissions had been given on the basis of students marks in the plus-2 exam.</p>
<p>She stated that though the counsel representing Tamil Nadu had made a strong case against NEET&nbsp;in the Supreme Court, it was still made mandatory.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Jayalalithaa has completed all the election rallies and wound up her campaign for this election at Tirunelveli. She addressed rallies in&nbsp;Virudachalam,&nbsp;Dharmapuri,&nbsp;Arupukkottai,&nbsp;Kancheepuram, Salem, &nbsp;Trichy,&nbsp;Madurai,&nbsp;Coimbatore,&nbsp;Villupuram,&nbsp;Perundurai,&nbsp;Thanjavur,&nbsp;Arakkonam&nbsp;and &nbsp;Tirunelveli. Her campaign kicked off on April 9 at island Grounds in Chennai.</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/india">India</a><a href="/authors/dna-web-team">dna Web Team</a><a href="/agencies/dna-webdesk">dna webdesk</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/j-jayalalithaa">J Jayalalithaa</a></li><li><a href="/topic/aiadmk">AIADMK</a></li><li><a href="/topic/neet">NEET</a></li><li><a href="/topic/neet-exam">NEET exam</a></li><li><a href="/topic/tamil-nadu-elections-2016">Tamil Nadu Elections 2016</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-12:45pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 12:45pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">

<item>
 <title>Rio 2016: Bernard Tomic opts out of Olympics, claims he is 'extremely busy' </title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/sport/report-tomic-opts-out-of-rio-olympics-claims-he-is-too-busy-2211957</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Bernard Tomic ruled himself out of representing Australia at the Rio Olympics in August due to his &quot;extremely busy&quot; playing schedule.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Tomic, who was warned by Australia&#39;s Olympic chef de mission Kitty Chiller he was among a group of athletes whose behaviour was being monitored to judge their suitability for the Rio team, will instead play an ATP tournament in Mexico.&nbsp;&quot;With a heavy sense of regret, I have made the difficult decision to not play with the Australian tennis team as they pursue an Olympic medal in Rio,&quot; the world number 22 said in a statement. &quot;I have always proudly represented my country in Davis Cup and given my all when wearing the green and gold. But on the basis of my extremely busy playing schedule and my own personal circumstances, I am regrettably unable to commit to this year&#39;s tournament.&quot;&nbsp;</p>
<p>Tomic drew heavy criticism last week following his exit from the Madrid Open when, on match point against Fabio Fognini, he held the racquet by the strings and did not offer a shot to the Italian&#39;s serve. The 23-year-old responded to the criticism by telling News Corp., &quot;I don&#39;t care about that match point. Would you care if you were 23 and worth over $10 million?&quot;</p>
<p>The response was described as &quot;appalling&quot; by Chiller and the criticism intensified when he pulled out of his opening match in Rome after just eight minutes, citing illness.&nbsp;Tomic&#39;s short career has been tinged with controversy and he was dubbed &#39;Tomic the Tank Engine&#39; after accusations he &#39;tanked&#39; -- or failed to try his best -- in a loss to Andy Roddick at the 2012 U.S. Open. He also holds the record for the quickest loss at a Masters-level tournament on the ATP Tour after being smashed 6-0 6-1 in 28 minutes by Finn Jarkko Nieminen in Miami in 2014.&nbsp;Tomic also came under fire in the leadup to this year&#39;s Australian Open for retiring during his Sydney International quarter-final after telling the chair umpire his mind was on the year&#39;s first grand slam.</p>
<p>He later claimed to have suffered food poisoning. Tomic whipped up more controversy during Australia&#39;s Davis Cup match against the United States in March when he criticised team mate Nick Kyrgios for withdrawing due to illness. He was also arrested and charged by Miami police for trespassing last year after holding a party in his room at a local hotel, though the charges were later dropped.&nbsp;</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/sport">Sport</a><a href="/agencies/reuters">Reuters</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/australia">Australia</a></li><li><a href="/topic/bernard-tomic">Bernard Tomic</a></li><li><a href="/topic/rio-games">Rio Games</a></li><li><a href="/topic/rio-olympics">Rio Olympics</a></li><li><a href="/topic/australian-open">Australian Open</a></li><li><a href="/topic/rio-2016">Rio 2016</a></li><li><a href="/topic/tennis">Tennis</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-12:20pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 12:20pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-article-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="img-responsive" src="http://static.dnaindia.com/sites/default/files/styles/half/public/2016/05/13/459892-418226-bernard-tomic-getty.jpg" width="640" height="360" alt="Bernard Tomic" title="Tomic opts out of Rio Olympics; claims he is too busy" /></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-article-image-caption field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Australia&#039;s Bernard Tomic ruled himself out of Rio Olympics by saying that he is too busy to participate in it.</div></div></div><a href="/agencies/afp-photo">AFP photo</a>  </div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-short-url field-type-text field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Short URL:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">dnai.in/dmyd</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-embargo field-type-list-boolean field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Embargo:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-syndicate field-type-list-boolean field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Syndicate:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-hide-lead-image field-type-list-boolean field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Hide lead image:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-page-views field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Page views:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">54</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-entityreference field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Related Articles:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Tennis Australia chief slams Tomic, Kyrgios for their recent misbehaviour </div><div class="field-item odd">Kyrgios supports fellow Aussie Tomic for failing to offer a shot against Fognini at the Madrid Open</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-print-edition field-type-list-boolean field-label-above"><div class="field-label">From Print Edition:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div></description>

<item>
 <title>Money Laundering case: Will Chhagan Bhujbal get bail today?</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-money-laundering-case-will-chhagan-bhujbal-get-bail-today-2211955</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>The special court for Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) is likely to pronounce its verdict on the bail plea filed by Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader and former Maharashtra minister Chhagan Bhujbal who has been arrested in a money laundering case in connection with the alleged Maharashtra Sadan scam.</p>
<p>The court had on Wednesday extended the judicial custody of Bhujbal and his nephew Sameer Bhujbal till May 25. Special Judge of the PMLA court, PR Bhavke heard the arguments of lawyers of Bhujbal and Enforcement Directorate before reserving the order.</p>
<p>The Enforcement Directorate had last week arrested Chhagan Bhujbal&#39;s associate and chartered accountant Sunil Naik in connection with the case.&nbsp;The special PMLA court had earlier issued a non-bailable warrant against Naik, who was the CA at Bhujbal- owned Mumbai Education Trust (MET) at Bandra.</p>
<p>The Enforcement Directorate is probing Bhujbal, his son Pankaj and nephew Sameer in the case concerning a contract the former allegedly gave a builder in 2005 without inviting tenders when he was the state&#39;s PWD minister. Earlier, a special trial court issued a non-bailable warrant against Pankaj Bhujbal and 28 others accused in a Rs&nbsp;800 crore money laundering case.</p>
<p>The Maharashtra Anti-Corruption Bureau had earlier filed two FIRs against the Bhujbals and others under the provisions of the PMLA to probe the Delhi-based Maharashtra Sadan scam and the Kalina land grabbing case.&nbsp;</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/india">India</a><a href="/agencies/ani">ANI</a><a href="/cities/mumbai-16">Mumbai</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/chhagan-bhujbal">Chhagan Bhujbal</a></li><li><a href="/topic/pankaj-bhujbal">Pankaj Bhujbal</a></li><li><a href="/topic/sameer-bhujbal">Sameer Bhujbal</a></li><li><a href="/topic/nationalist-congress-party-ncp">Nationalist Congress Party (NCP)</a></li><li><a href="/topic/maharashtra-sadan-scam">Maharashtra Sadan scam</a></li><li><a href="/topic/prevention-of-money-laundering-act-pmla">Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA)</a></li><li><a href="/topic/enforcement-directorate-ed">Enforcement Directorate (ED)</a></li><li><a href="/topic/sunil-naik">Sunil Naik</a></li><li><a href="/topic/maharashtra-anti-corruption-bureau-acb">Maharashtra Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB)</a></li><li><a href="/topic/mumbai-education-trust-met">Mumbai Education Trust (MET)</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-12:02pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 12:02pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">

<item>
 <title>China elevates military command along Indian border: Report</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-china-elevates-military-command-along-indian-border-report-2211953</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>&nbsp;In a surprise move, China has elevated the rank of Tibet&#39;s Military Command which looks after the security along its border with India by putting it under the jurisdiction of PLA ground forces, suggesting it may &quot;undertake some kind of military combat mission in future.&quot; &quot;China raises Tibet Military Command&#39;s (TMC) power rank,&quot; state-run Global Times said in a frontpage report.</p>
<p>&quot;The TMC&#39;s political rank will be elevated to one level higher than its counterpart provincial-level military commands and will come under the leadership of the People&#39;s Liberation Army (PLA),&quot; it reported citing another official newspaper the &#39;China Youth Daily.&#39;&nbsp;&quot;The promotion marks a new journey for the TMC command&#39;s construction,&quot; it said.</p>
<p>The sudden &quot;elevation&quot; surprised many observers as the PLA in this year&#39;s reform brought most of the provincial military commands under the control of Central Military Commission&#39;s (CMC) new National Defence Mobilisation Department.&nbsp;CMC, the overall high command of the PLA, is directly headed by President Xi Jinping, who is also the head of the ruling Communist Party.</p>
<p>&quot;The TMC on the other hand, is under the leadership of the Chinese ground forces, which suggests that the command may undertake some kind of military combat mission in the future,&quot; the report quoted a &quot;source close to the matter&quot; as saying.&nbsp;There was no elaboration of what the &quot;military combat mission&quot; will be.&nbsp;Seasoned military observers termed the report confusing.</p>
<p>Until last year, China had seven military area commands in Beijing, Nanjing, Chengdu, Jinan, Shenyang, Lanzhou and Guangzhou. Of this Chengdu looked after security of India&#39;s Eastern sector in the Tibet region including Arunachal Pradesh while Lanzhou in Xinjiang looked after partly the western sector, including Kashmir region and Pakistan.&nbsp;As per the new strategic zone plan, both Chengdu and Lanzhou gets integrated into strategic command region making it perhaps the biggest areas for Chinese military.</p>
<p>TMC may perhaps get a four-star General instead of a Lt General, while Lanzhou where the combat forces are stationed is already led by a General. &quot;Loosely put it, the report is very confusing. we need to more information to get a proper prospective,&quot; a senior military official told PTI.</p>
<p>India-China borders largely enjoy peace and tranquillity, notwithstanding the dispute over the 3,488-km long border.&nbsp;They have set up mechanism at the ground and at the level of the government to address issues relating to the recurring transgressions by PLA troops in the areas claimed by India.</p>
<p>The issue was broadly discussed during last month&#39;s visit of Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar to China during which the two sides agreed to set up &#39;Hot Lines&#39; between the militaries.<br />
	&nbsp;</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/india">India</a><a href="/agencies/pti">PTI</a><a href="/cities/beijing-1">Beijing</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/beijing">Beijing</a></li><li><a href="/topic/manohar-parrikar">Manohar Parrikar</a></li><li><a href="/topic/xi-jinping">Xi Jinping</a></li><li><a href="/topic/arunachal-pradesh">Arunachal Pradesh</a></li><li><a href="/topic/china">China</a></li><li><a href="/topic/chinese-army">Chinese Army</a></li><li><a href="/topic/tibet">Tibet</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-12:40pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 12:40pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">

<item>
 <title>Saudi Arabia's Aramco finalises IPO options; plans global expansion</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/money/report-saudi-arabia-s-aramco-finalises-ipo-options-and-plans-global-expansion-2211952</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Global demand Saudi Arabia&#39;s state-owned oil giant&nbsp;Aramco&nbsp;is finalising proposals for its partial privatisation and will present them to its Supreme Council soon, its chief executive said about the centrepiece of the kingdom&#39;s efforts to overhaul its economy.</p>
<p>The company has a huge team working on the options for the initial public offering (IPO) of less than 5% of its value, which include a single domestic listing and a dual listing&nbsp;with&nbsp;a foreign market, CEO&nbsp;Amin&nbsp;Nasser&nbsp;said on Tuesday.</p>
<p>They will be presented &quot;soon&quot; to&nbsp;Aramco&#39;s&nbsp;Supreme Council, headed by Deputy Crown Prince Mohammed bin&nbsp;Salman, who is leading an economic reform drive to address falling oil revenue and sharp fiscal deficits by boosting the private sector, ending government waste and diversifying the economy.</p>
<p>Nasser&nbsp;stressed that even after the listing, the Saudi government would retain sole control over&nbsp;Aramco&#39;s&nbsp;oil and gas output levels. &quot;Production is sovereign,&quot; he said.</p>
<p>Riyadh has traditionally kept an expensive &quot;spare cushion&quot; of excess production capacity, allowing it to raise or reduce levels to influence prices according to the government&#39;s market strategy. Private oil companies, by contrast, do not hold back output for strategic gain.</p>
<div class="col-xs-12 col-md-4 col-lg-4  col-sm-12" id="glance" style="width: 50%;float:left;padding-right: 10px;margin-right: 10px;">
<div class="panel panel-default" style="padding: 0px;background-color: #ededed;border: 2px solid #fdfae5;box-shadow: 1px 1px 10px #b8b6b6;">
<div class="panel-body">
<div class="atGlance" style="background-color: #ffc20e;width: 64%;font-size: 19px;font-weight: 600;padding-left: 9px;">AT A GLANCE</div>
<div class="atGlaPadding" style="margin-top: 15px;">
<ul style="font-size: 16px;">
<li><span class="apple-converted-space">Aramco&nbsp;changes central to overhaul of Saudi economy</span></li>
<li><span class="apple-converted-space">IPO&nbsp;proposals for sale of less than 5% to come soon&nbsp;</span></li>
<li><span class="apple-converted-space">Firm looking at US, India, Indonesia, Vietnam and China</span></li>
<li>Oil output levels will stay as government decision</li>
<li>Global oil demand seen growing at 1.2 mn&nbsp;bpd this year</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<p>Nasser&nbsp;also said&nbsp;Aramco&nbsp;was seeking to expand globally via joint ventures in Asia and North America.</p>
<p>&quot;We are looking at the current market status that, even though challenging, is an excellent opportunity for growth,&quot;&nbsp;Nasser&nbsp;said, adding that he was looking at opportunities in the United States, India, Indonesia, Vietnam and China.</p>
<p>The CEO was speaking to reporters during a rare media visit to the company&#39;s extensive, well-guarded Dhahran headquarters, located near where American oilmen first struck the Arabian Peninsula&#39;s enormous crude reserves at Well Number 7 in 1938.</p>
<p>Besides proposing to sell a stake in the company, which would require it to release sensitive reserves data, Riyadh has asked&nbsp;Aramco&nbsp;to play a big role in developing industrial projects aimed at stimulating non-oil economic sectors.</p>
<p>Last month, Prince Mohammed said he expected the&nbsp;IPO&nbsp;would value&nbsp;Aramco&nbsp;at at least $2 trillion, but that he thought the figure might end up being higher. Any valuation would account for both oil price expectations and the size of Saudi Arabia&#39;s proven oil reserves.<br />
	&nbsp;</p>
<h3>Growing Demand</h3>
<p>Company officials said Saudi Arabia had discovered a total of 805.6 billion barrels of oil, of which 141.5 billion had already been produced and 260 billion barrels were considered &quot;proven&quot;, the industry term for reserves that can definitely be extracted.</p>
<p>Aramco&nbsp;also had 403 billion barrels of reserves it could probably extract, they said, adding that it hoped to add another 100 billion barrels to total reserves by 2025 by increasing the recovery rate by 50-70% using new technology.</p>
<p>Aramco&nbsp;expects global crude oil demand to grow by 1.2 million barrels per day this year, he&nbsp;said and has seen increasing demand in the United States and India.</p>
<p>&quot;We will meet the call on Saudi&nbsp;Aramco,&quot;&nbsp;Nasser&nbsp;said, adding that the company will increase capacity in future if needed, but that for the time being its maximum sustainable capacity would stay at 12 million&nbsp;bpd, with a total&nbsp;capacity of 12.5 million&nbsp;bpd.</p>
<p>Saudi&nbsp;Aramco&nbsp;produced an average of 10.2 million&nbsp;bpd&nbsp;of crude in 2015, he said, adding there had been a big drop in oil output among non-conventional and even other conventional producers.</p>
<p>The expansion of the&nbsp;Khurais&nbsp;oilfield&nbsp;will come on stream in 2018, he said, adding that the latest stage of its expansion project at the southeastern&nbsp;Shaybah&nbsp;oil field would be finished &quot;in a couple of weeks&quot;.</p>
<p>The increased capacity of 250,000&nbsp;bpd, taking&nbsp;Shaybah&#39;s&nbsp;total production capacity to 1 million&nbsp;bpd, is aimed at&nbsp;rebalancing&nbsp;Saudi Arabia&#39;s crude oil quality and at compensating for falling output at other fields as they mature.</p>
<p>The immense Saudi&nbsp;Aramco&nbsp;complex in Dhahran resembles a small city, with its large residential complex, its own hospital, sports stadium and parks.</p>
<p>Inside a sleek control room, technicians monitored huge screens that showed via digital graphics the core elements of the business, from the progress of oil tankers across the oceans to the available crude grades and refining facilities.</p>
<p>At&nbsp;Aramco&#39;s&nbsp;research centre nearby, officials showed reporters &quot;the cave&quot;, a colourful virtual representation on wraparound screens of drilling operations under the&nbsp;Shaybah&nbsp;oil field.</p>
<p>	Industrialisation</p>
<p>Aramco&#39;s&nbsp;continued investment in downstream industry is seen as a crucial element of economic diversification plans. One example of this is its plans to sign an agreement soon with Saudi Basic Industries&nbsp;Corp&nbsp;(Sabic), the state-run petrochemical and metals conglomerate, to jointly develop an oil-to-chemicals project, an official said in a briefing to reporters.</p>
<p>The project, likely to cost up to $30 billion, would chime with efforts to better integrate the kingdom&#39;s energy and industrial sectors. On Saturday a new Energy, Industry and Mineral Resources Ministry was created in place of the old oil ministry.</p>
<p>Another example is its huge ship repair and shipbuilding complex that it is developing at&nbsp;Ras&nbsp;al-Khair&nbsp;on the kingdom&#39;s east coast to be fully operational by 2021,&nbsp;Nasser&nbsp;said.</p>
<p>The first part of the shipbuilding complex will be ready by 2018, and it will eventually make oil rigs and tankers,&nbsp;Nasser&nbsp;said.</p>
<p>A presentation by the company said the complex would create 80,000 jobs and allow Saudi Arabia to reduce its imports by $12&nbsp;billion while increasing the country&#39;s gross domestic product by $17 billion.&nbsp;</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/money">Money</a><a href="/agencies/reuters">Reuters</a><a href="/cities/dahran">Dahran</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/saudi-aramco">Saudi Aramco</a></li><li><a href="/topic/saudi-arabia">Saudi Arabia</a></li><li><a href="/topic/china">China</a></li><li><a href="/topic/indonesia">Indonesia</a></li><li><a href="/topic/riyadh">Riyadh</a></li><li><a href="/topic/united-states">United States</a></li><li><a href="/topic/sabic">SABIC</a></li><li><a href="/topic/oil">OIL</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-11:55am</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 11:55am</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-article-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="img-responsive" src="http://static.dnaindia.com/sites/default/files/styles/half/public/2016/05/13/459888-oil-getty.png" width="640" height="360" alt="Representational Image" title="Representational Image" /></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-article-image-caption field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Representational Image</div></div></div><a href="/agencies/getty-images">Getty Images</a>  </div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-short-url field-type-text field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Short URL:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">dnai.in/dmy8</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-embargo field-type-list-boolean field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Embargo:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-syndicate field-type-list-boolean field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Syndicate:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-hide-lead-image field-type-list-boolean field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Hide lead image:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-page-views field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Page views:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">26</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-entityreference field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Related Articles:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Saudi Arabia&#039;s Aramco studying offers for Indian oil refinery stakes: Dharmendra Pradhan</div><div class="field-item odd">World&#039;s largest oil firm Aramco plans to invest in India&#039;s petroleum sector</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-print-edition field-type-list-boolean field-label-above"><div class="field-label">From Print Edition:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"></div></div></div></description>

<item>
 <title>SC to pronounce verdict on pleas challenging criminal defamation today</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-sc-to-pronounce-verdict-on-pleas-challenging-criminal-defamation-today-2211950</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>&nbsp;The Supreme Court will on Friday pronounce its verdict on a batch of petitions including by Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader Subramanian Swamy challenging the constitutional validity of Sections 499 and 500 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) providing for criminal defamation.</p>
<p>The petitioners had argued that the criminal defamation under these sections of the IPC travelled beyond constitution&#39;s article 19(2) that imposes reasonable restriction on the freedom of speech and expression.<br />
	The verdict was reserved on August 13 last year after bench of Justice Dipak Misra and Justice Prafulla C. Pant heard the matter spread over a month.</p>
<p>Swamy and Gandhi have been charged with criminal defamation under Sections 499 and 500 of the IPC for their political speeches made in Tamil Nadu and Maharashtra respectively, while Kejriwal is facing cases under the same provisions lodged by BJP&#39;s Nitin Gadkari and others.&nbsp;</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/india">India</a><a href="/agencies/ani">ANI</a><a href="/cities/new-delhi-29">New Delhi</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/supreme-court">Supreme Court</a></li><li><a href="/topic/rahul-gandhi">Rahul Gandhi</a></li><li><a href="/topic/arvind-kejriwal">Arvind Kejriwal</a></li><li><a href="/topic/subramanian-swamy">Subramanian Swamy</a></li><li><a href="/topic/nitin-gadkari">Nitin Gadkari</a></li><li><a href="/topic/dipak-mishra">Dipak Mishra</a></li><li><a href="/topic/indian-penal-code-ipc">Indian Penal Code (IPC)</a></li><li><a href="/topic/criminal-defamation">criminal defamation</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-11:25am</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 11:25am</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-article-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="img-responsive" src="http://static.dnaindia.com/sites/default/files/styles/half/public/2016/05/13/459887-428941-supreme-court.jpg" width="640" height="360" alt="Supreme Court" title="Supreme Court" /></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-article-image-caption field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Supreme Court</div></div></div>  </div>

<item>
 <title>Donald Trump renounces ex-butler Anthony Senecal after he called for Obama's murder</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/world/report-donald-trump-renounces-ex-butler-anthony-senecal-after-he-called-for-obama-s-murder-2211949</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>United States Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump has disavowed his former butler Anthony Senecal, after he posted on Facebook that he wants President Barack Obama to be killed.</p>
<p>According to CNN, Anthony Senecal, who served as Trump&#39;s butler for 17 years wrote in a Facebook post that Obama &quot;should have been taken out by our military and shot as an enemy agent in his first term,&quot; according to Mother Jones, which first reported on Senecal&#39;s post.&nbsp;Senecal, 84, confirmed he wrote the post to CNN, but disputed one point, &quot;I think I said hung.</p>
<p>&quot;Either way, I don&#39;t care. Hanging, shooting -- I&#39;d prefer he&#39;d be hung from the portico of the White House, or as I call it, the white mosque. Does it sound like I&#39;m nuts? Because I&#39;m not,&quot; he said. &quot;I&#39;ve just gotten fed up with him (Obama).&quot; Senecal said.&nbsp;Trump&#39;s campaign disavowed the &quot;horrible statements&quot; in a statement Thursday afternoon.</p>
<p>&quot;Tony Senecal has not worked at Mar-a-Lago for years, but nevertheless we totally and completely disavow the horrible statements made by him regarding the President,&quot; campaign spokeswoman Hope Hicks said.&nbsp;Senecal wrote at least a dozen similarly provocative posts on Facebook insulting Obama and calling for him to be hanged. He has also targeted Clinton, calling her a &quot;lying b----&quot; and referring to her as &quot;killery.&quot;<br />
	Senecal most recently saw Trump about one month ago and said that he spoke briefly with him about his successful presidential campaign.&nbsp;<br />
	&nbsp;</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/world">World</a><a href="/agencies/ani">ANI</a><a href="/cities/washington-12">Washington</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/donald-trump">Donald Trump</a></li><li><a href="/topic/anthony-senecal">Anthony Senecal</a></li><li><a href="/topic/barack-obama">Barack Obama</a></li><li><a href="/topic/republican-party">Republican Party</a></li><li><a href="/topic/facebook">Facebook</a></li><li><a href="/topic/us-presidential-elections-2016">US Presidential Elections 2016</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-11:35am</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 11:35am</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">
