<item>
 <title>Finance Ministry wants clarification on black money scheme by May 25</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/money/report-finance-ministry-seek-clarification-on-black-money-scheme-by-may-25-2211947</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>With the scheme for domestic black money holders to come clean by paying tax and penalty set to become operational from June 1, the Finance Ministry on Thursday asked the public to seek clarifications on it by May 25.</p>
<p>The Income Declaration Scheme, 2016 provides an opportunity to persons who have not paid full tax in the past to come forward and declare the undisclosed income and pay tax, surcharge and penalty totalling in all to 45% of such undisclosed income so declared.</p>
<p>&quot;The stake holders and the general public are requested to bring out issues/points which in their opinion would require further clarification/guidance.</p>
<p>In his Budget speech, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley had said a four-month window would be provided for people to declare undisclosed income with an option to pay the amount due within two months of the declaration.</p>
<p>Disclosures made will be kept secret with the addition of Sections 138 and 119 of the Income-tax Act in the scheme.</p>
<p>&quot;The Income Declaration Scheme, 2016 incorporated as Chapter IX of the Finance Bill 2016 and The Direct Tax Dispute Resolution Scheme 2016 incorporated as Chapter X of the Finance Bill 2016 are expected to come into force on the 1st of June, 2016 after the Finance Act 2016 receives the Presidential assent,&quot; the Ministry said.</p>
<p>The Direct Tax Dispute Resolution Scheme is aimed to resolve cases pending in any Court, Tribunal, Arbitration or mediation under the Bilateral Investment Protection Agreement (BIPA).</p>
<p>The Finance Bill was approved by Parliament on Wednesday when the Rajya Sabha returned it after a brief discussion to the Lok Sabha.</p>
<p>These issues/points may be submitted by May 25 at &#39;media.cbdt@gmail.com&#39; or by post to the Central Board of Direct Taxes.</p>
<p>Sanjay Kumar, Senior Advisor, Deloitte in India said the Direct Tax Dispute Resolution Scheme is the new avatar of the earlier scheme brought in the late 1990s, &quot;evokes doubts about whether there will be enough takers because many cases do not have very justified assessment orders based on evidence, and the taxpayers in many cases may get full relief from the appellate authorities.&rdquo;</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/money">Money</a><a href="/agencies/pti">PTI</a><a href="/cities/new-delhi-29">New Delhi</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/finance-ministry">Finance Ministry</a></li><li><a href="/topic/arun-jaitley">Arun Jaitley</a></li><li><a href="/topic/finance-bill">Finance Bill</a></li><li><a href="/topic/lok-sabha">Lok Sabha</a></li><li><a href="/topic/rajya-sabha">Rajya Sabha</a></li><li><a href="/topic/black-money">Black Money</a></li><li><a href="/topic/income-declaration-scheme">Income Declaration Scheme</a></li><li><a href="/topic/bilateral-investment-protection-agreement-bipa">Bilateral Investment Protection Agreement (BIPA)</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-11:50am</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 11:50am</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">

<item>
 <title>Snapdeal invested nearly Rs 1,996 crore in supply chain, logistics over 18-months</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/money/report-snapdeal-invested-nearly-rs-1990-crore-in-supply-chain-and-logistics-over-18-months-2211946</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>E-commerce major Snapdeal has pumped in $300 million (about Rs 1,995.8 crore) over the last 18 months to strengthen its supply chain and logistics and facilitate the increase in shipment volumes.</p>
<p>The city-based firm has seen 1.9 times increase in shipment volumes from 1.29 lakh daily shipments last year to 2.5 lakh this year.</p>
<p>&quot;We have seen a significant increase of 1.9 times in shipment volumes. This is on account of increase in assortment on Snapdeal from 12 million to 35 million over the year. We have also expanded our seller base which helped increase shipments,&quot; Snapdeal Chief Customer Experience Officer Jayant Sood said.</p>
<p>He added that reports by PwC and RedSeer Consulting suggest that Snapdeal&#39;s promised delivery time is the shortest across India.</p>
<p>&quot;The number of sellers on our platform has increased three-fold from 1,00,000 at the beginning of 2015 to more than 3,00,000 in 2016... We have invested USD 300 million towards logistics and customer experience,&quot; he said.</p>
<p>He added that the company has 2 million sq ft of warehousing space across 63 sites and 45 cities.</p>
<p>Sood said the seller expansion has also led to a huge increase in the goods available on its platform.</p>
<p>&quot;Unlike other competing marketplaces, which have their own sellers under various arrangements, we have no such conflicting interests. This makes Snapdeal more attractive for sellers,&quot; he said.</p>
<p>He said the company has seen 60% month-on-month increase in FMCG sales while the books category grew by 300%. Also, there is a strong increase in uptake in the home decor category.</p>
<p>&quot;This blend of expansion of high-frequency categories drives high repeat usage, which is enabled by reliable experience each time,&quot; he added.</p>
<p>Besides, sharp focus on repeat users and initiatives like same day refunds is helping Snapdeal &quot;chart a distinct course&quot;, he said.&nbsp;</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/money">Money</a><a href="/agencies/pti">PTI</a><a href="/cities/new-delhi-29">New Delhi</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/e-commerce">e-commerce</a></li><li><a href="/topic/snapdeal">Snapdeal</a></li><li><a href="/topic/logistics">logistics</a></li><li><a href="/topic/jayant-sood">Jayant Sood</a></li><li><a href="/topic/pwc">PWC</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-11:45am</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 11:45am</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-article-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="img-responsive" src="http://static.dnaindia.com/sites/default/files/styles/half/public/2016/05/13/459883-snapdeal-reuters.jpg" width="640" height="360" alt="Snapdeal invested $300mn in supply chain and logistics " title="Snapdeal invested $300mn in supply chain and logistics " /></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-article-image-caption field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Snapdeal invested $300mn (nearly Rs 1,990 crore) in supply chain and logistics </div></div></div><a href="/agencies/reuters">Reuters</a><a href="/authors/file-photo">File Photo</a>  </div>

<item>
 <title>Doping crisis deepens in Russia as NYT report names 15 medal winners in Sochi</title>
 <link>http://www.dnaindia.com/sport/report-drug-crisis-deepens-in-russia-as-investigative-report-brings-out-shocking-news-2211943</link>
 <description><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>World sport is facing an unprecedented drug crisis as yet another in a string of doping bombshells dropped at the World Anti-Doping Agency&#39;s (WADA) foundation board meeting on Thursday, shocking officials.&nbsp;</p>
<p>WADA, the International Olympic Committee (IOC) and athletes were all left stunned by an explosive New York Times report that detailed widespread doping by Russia at the 2014 Sochi Winter Olympics, including 15 medal winners.&nbsp;It was all part of a dark day for anti-doping crusaders as Russia was once again in the spotlight along with Kenya, after the African nation famous for its middle and long-distance runners was declared non-compliant and now faces a possible Olympic ban.&nbsp;</p>
<p>In recent months, WADA has appeared to be losing ground in the war on performance-enhancing drugs and the agency suffered another setback on Thursday when the New York Times story landed smack in the middle of its board meeting.&nbsp;Alarm bells were ringing as WADA members absorbed details of a Times report that quoted Grigory Rodchenkov, the former head of Russia&#39;s drug testing laboratory, recounting dozens of cover-ups and the disposal of tainted samples.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Reuters was unable to verify details of the Times report. Even Dick Pound, the Canadian lawyer who helped set up the WADA and served two terms as its president, was left surprised by the scope and sophistication of the cover-up, labelling it the worst he has ever seen.&nbsp;&quot;He (Rodchenkov) knows where all the bodies are buried,&quot; Pound told Reuters. &quot;This (Times report) is as bad as we&#39;ve seen assuming what Rodchenkov says is true and he does have the knowledge of what was going on. That&#39;s pretty bad.&nbsp;&quot;He knew what was going on, it&#39;s not just &#39;she said, he said&#39;.&quot; Late last year, an independent commission headed by Pound uncovered evidence of state-sponsored doping in Russia that led to the country being banned from all athletics competition.</p>
<p>	SCANDAL DEEPENED&nbsp;</p>
<p>The scandal deepened on Sunday when whistleblower Vitaly Stepanov claimed in an interview with investigative programme &quot;60 Minutes&quot; that he had taped recordings of Rodchenkov telling him at least four Russian gold medallists in Sochi were using steroids.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&quot;It shows the system can be broken rather simply,&quot; outgoing WADA director general David Howman told Reuters. &quot;It is something I have worried about for a long time.&nbsp;&quot;It looks on the surface there might have been quite a big &#39;get away&#39;. The real question is the way this is a systematic program.&nbsp;That&#39;s come out in the report we got from our independent commission. This just confirms it and takes it a couple of steps further which is hugely worrying.&quot;&nbsp;</p>
<p>With the Rio Olympics just three months away, the IOC must quickly deal with the escalating controversy if it is to restore confidence in the Summer Games in particular and sport in general.&nbsp;It is clear that athlete confidence has plunged to all-time low. Beckie Scott, chair of the athletes commission, made an emotional plea to the foundation board urging WADA to use its influence to keep Russian drug cheats out of the Rio Games.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&quot;We acknowledge that WADA does not have jurisdiction over the Olympic Games,&quot; said Scott, who won bronze at the 2002 Salt Lake City Winter Games but was upgraded to gold after the two Russians who finished ahead of her were found guilty of doping. &quot;WADA does have, however, influence and clean athletes of the world propose that you use that influence with respect to Rio and Game beyond. &quot;Athletes strongly feel that if there cannot be a guarantee that athletes there from Russia are clean and not involved in doping activity that they should not be there.&quot;</p>
<p>Even in the face of mounting evidence, Russian officials continued to deny any wrong doing with sports minister Vitaly Mutko dismissing the New York Times report as nonsense, according to the TASS news agency. &quot;I believe these guys, they are outstanding athletes, the charges are nonsense,&quot; Mutko, who has previously said doping checks at Sochi were under the control of international experts, was quoted as saying. &quot;The charges against them are groundless. We will study this article and see how to react.&quot;&nbsp;</p>
</div></div></div><a href="/slug/report">Report</a><a href="/sport">Sport</a><a href="/agencies/reuters">Reuters</a><a href="/cities/montreal">Montreal</a><ul><li><a href="/topic/international-olympic-committee-ioc">International Olympic Committee (IOC)</a></li><li><a href="/topic/the-world-anti-doping-agency-wada">The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA)</a></li><li><a href="/topic/russia">Russia</a></li><li><a href="/topic/grigory-rodchenkov">Grigory Rodchenkov</a></li><li><a href="/topic/sochi-winter-olympics">Sochi Winter Olympics</a></li><li><a href="/topic/whistleblower">Whistleblower</a></li><li><a href="/topic/vitaly-stepanov">Vitaly Stepanov</a></li></ul><div class="field field-name-field-date-published field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Fri, 13 May 2016-12:30pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-date-updated field-type-datestamp field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Date updated:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Friday, 13 May 2016 - 12:30pm</span></div></div></div><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-article-images field-type-field-collection field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Article Images:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-article-images clearfix">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-article-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img class="img-responsive" src="http://static.dnaindia.com/sites/default/files/styles/half/public/2016/05/13/459886-347633-doping.jpg" width="640" height="360" alt="Anti-doping" title="Drug crisis deepens in Russia as investigative report brings out shocking news" /></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-article-image-caption field-type-text-long field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) was left shocked on Thursday, as New York Times report showed evidence of Grigory Rodchenkoy, the former head of Russia&#039;s drug testing lab, recounting cover-ups and disposal of tainted samples.</div></div></div><a href="/agencies/file-photo">File Photo</a>  </div>
</div>
